medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive neurological decline with gait difficulties, dysarthria, swallowing difficulties, and visual impairment.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient began experiencing running difficulty at age 5, followed by gait difficulties and unsteadiness, and progressive dysarthria. At age 6, she had prolonged swallowing time and painful spasms in her left lower limb. By age 10, mild kyphoscoliosis and rapidly progressive visual impairment were noted, with corneal opacities detected. She developed progressive generalized dystonia with oromandibular involvement and intermittent facial grimacing, evolving into akinetic-rigid parkinsonism. Speech deteriorated progressively, becoming anarthric by age 16. PEG-fed since age 20.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Born prematurely at 32 gestational weeks; otherwise unremarkable past medical history.
medical_history.family_history: Parents, one older sister, and one half-brother are in good health; no significant family medical history reported.
